# Welcome {-}

```{r "intro"}
#| echo: false
.gh_url <- file.path('https://github.com', rmarkdown::metadata[['github-repo']])
pkglines <- read.dcf("DESCRIPTION")
pkg <- pkglines[, "Package"][[1]]
version <- pkglines[, "Version"][[1]]
authors <- eval(parse(text = pkglines[, "Authors@R"]))
license <- pkglines[, "License"][[1]]
intro <- glue::glue(
    "**Package:** {pkg}<br/>\n", 
    "**Authors:** {paste(format(authors, include = c('given', 'family', 'role')), collapse = ', ')}<br/>\n", 
    "**Compiled:** {as.character(Sys.Date())}<br/>\n", 
    "**Package version:** {version}<br/>\n", 
    "**R version:** {R.version.string}<br/>\n", 
    "**BioC version:** {BiocManager::version()}<br/>\n", 
    "**License:** {license}<br/>"
)
```

`r intro`

This is the landing page of the `BiocBook` entitled 
*Write, containerize, publish and versionize Quarto books with Bioconductor*.  

This book introduces the reader to the `BiocBook` **package** and the 
auto-generated, versionized **Docker images** and **website**.

![](inst/img/workflow.png)

# Main features {-}

- Create a fully configured `BiocBook` without leaving R with the `BiocBook` package
- Write book chapters in `.qmd` files and enhanced markdown 
- Publish different book versions for different Bioconductor releases
- Containerize different Docker images of your book for different Bioconductor releases

## Get started now üéâ

You can get access to all the packages used in this book in < 1 minute, 
using this command in a terminal: 

```{sh "docker", filename="bash"}
#| eval: false
docker run -it ghcr.io/js2264/biocbook:devel R
```

:::

# RStudio Server {-}

An RStudio Server instance can be initiated from the `Docker` image as follows: 

```{sh "rstudio", filename="bash"}
#| eval: false
docker run \
    --volume <local_folder>:<destination_folder> \
    -e PASSWORD=OHCA \
    -p 8787:8787 \
    ghcr.io/js2264/biocbook:devel
```

The initiated RStudio Server instance will be available at 
[https://localhost:8787](https://localhost:8787).

# Reproducibility {-}

This `BiocBook` has been written using the 
[`BiocBook` package](https://github.com/js2264/BiocBook) (@serizay2023), 
and also relies on other packages, including (but not only): 

- `quarto` (@Allaire_Quarto_2022)
- `devtools` (@Wickham2022)

To build this book locally, you can run: 

```{sh "reproducibility", filename="bash"}
#| eval: false
git clone git@github.com:js2264/BiocBook.git && cd BiocBook
Rscript -e 'remotes::install_local(".", force = TRUE)'
quarto render
```
